I'm working on a test harness which sends messages to an application 
and verifies the output against a text file.  Upon running its 200 
some odd tests, it creates a report of the results of the tests.  OK, 
sounds like something JUnit might be able to handle.  However, the 
basic test that I want to to compare the output file with the 
expected result file.  If the files do differ, then I'd like a 
listing of ALL the places where they differ.  Is there anything in 
JUnit or any of its extensions that does something like this?  I know 
this is not really unit testing, more like black box application 
testing, but I like the formatting and gui options of JUnit and would 
like to be able to use it if possible.  

Thanks in advance,
Adam
